title_narrative: Mines Advisory Group, MAG, Mines Iraq, 2013-2014
Mines Advisory Group, MAG, Mines Iraq, 2013-2014
sector_narrative: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
description_narrative: MAG implementerar sina minröjningsoperationer under 2013-2014 i syfte att undanröja de humanitära och socio-ekonomiska hindren som minor    utgör, i ett av världens mest mintäta länder, Irak. I norra Irak, där projektet implementeras, kommer även kapacitetsutveckling av den      regionala myndigheten som är ansvarig för minröjning, IKMAA, att      inbegripas i projektet.

MAG implements its demining operations during 2013-2014 in order to   address the humanitarian and socio-economic barriers that mines pose, in one of the world's most contaminated countries, Iraq. In northern  Iraq, where the project is implemented, it will also focus on         capacity development of the regional authority responsible for        demining, IKMAA.
result_description_narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The project has reached its objectives, except for parts of the training component targeting the Kurdish authority for Mine Action (IKMAA). 

20 minefields and 10 BAC (Battle Area Clearance) corresponding to 1 300 000 m2 cleared. Risk education activities targeting over 37 000 persons conducted including farmers,  shepherds, refugees,students and teachers. 389 hazardous items destroyed. Overall the achievements  correspond to the goals set. The area where goals were not entirely met is the capacity development support to the IKMAA. Two out of four trainings were cancelled on IKMAA's demand and due to the security situation.
result_indicator_description_narrative: No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
